content: Yes, staying ahead of smugglers and drug traffickers is essential in reducing the amount of illegal drugs that enter countries around the world. The use of advanced technologies, such as satellite imagery and surveillance, enables maritime law enforcement agencies to identify and track suspect vessels, and international cooperation enables them to share intelligence, coordinate operations, and exchange best practices. These are necessary steps in making it more difficult for smuggling and drug trafficking organizations to carry out their illegal activities. By staying ahead of the smugglers, maritime law enforcement agencies can make substantial progress in reducing drug trafficking and related crimes.
